headline: Should David Simon’s Klépierre Exit and Copley Luxury Overhaul Reframe Simon Property Group’s (SPG) Strategy?
summary: Simon Property Group recently announced that CEO David Simon resigned from the Supervisory Board of European mall owner Klépierre S.A., effective 19 February 2026, while separately unveiling a major luxury-focused redevelopment of the former Neiman Marcus space at Boston’s Copley Place with new high-end retail and dining concepts. The combination of leadership change at a key European affiliate, where Simon holds a 22% stake, and the experience-centered Copley Place overhaul highlights how...
